column2: We the people of Hillsbrad do solemnly swear our faith and devotion to the Alliance maintained by the great monarchs, King Magni Bronzebeard of Ironforge and King Anduin Wrynn of Stormwind. A political document revered by the human inhabitants of the Hillsbrad Foothills.

We the people of Hillsbrad do solemnly swear our faith and devotion to the Alliance maintained by the great monarchs, King Magni Bronzebeard of Ironforge and King Anduin Wrynn of Stormwind. Herein lies the town registry for purposes of governing this fair city in the foothills of the great Alterac Mountains as well as serving as a record of those who have paid their taxes to their Kings and to the great almighty Alliance.

Rare indeed are the 'prismatic' blades forged by the combined will of the five dragonflights. Among the greatest of these blades were the sister swords of Quel'Serrar and Quel'Delar. In her wisdom, the dragon queen Alexstrasza gifted one of the blades to each of the elven peoples of Azeroth. Quel'Serrar was to be borne by a valiant kaldorei warrior, while Quel'Delar was entrusted to a quel'dorei champion. Each blade transformed in the hands of its wielder, molding its magic to its master's strengths... A book containing information about the prismatic dragon blades of old. The fact that it was written by a member of the red dragonflight confers great prestige on the holder.

The Arm of Gri'lek. It contains ancient troll lore that I must learn, and [...] Alterac was the last known location of an intact copy of this book. - Loremaster Dibbs. A book about Gri'lek the Wanderer, who lost an arm and searched in vain to recover it. The tale is sacred to the Darkspear trolls.

Although the cover of this book is marred by scratches and caked with mud, the words 'The History of Stormwind' can still be read along its spine. Upon opening the book, the seal of the Stormwind Library is clearly stamped on the book's first page. "This book hasn't rested on these shelves since before the rebuilding of Stormwind, years ago. It will have to be restored of course, it's in bad shape, but I would be honored to place it within our rare books collection." - Milton Sheaf, Stormwind Royal Library.

Written by the Dwarven miner Margulf Blaggon a few decades ago. He spent most his time deep in the mountains of Khaz Modan, digging ore. Smart fellow! - Milton Sheaf, Stormwind Royal Library. A highly regarded book about metallurgy.

Written by Ur of Dalaran. The swirling symbols and pictograms that fill the pages of this manual are esoteric beyond comprehension. "Its secrets are not meant for the untrained, and plumbing its depths can lead to doom and ruin." - High Sorcerer Andromath
Robes worn by Arugal, former royal archmage of Gilneas and member of the Kirin Tor.
Belt worn by Arugal, former royal archmage of Gilneas and member of the Kirin Tor.

How Arugal gained acceptance within the Kirin Tor is beyond me. His spell-casting knowledge seemed as transparent as a blown glass bauble. Arugal used enchanted items to reinforce his weak magic. Improves Learning at the expense of one's reputation.
Dagger wielded by Arugal, former royal archmage of Gilneas and member of the Kirin Tor. Melee attacks have a chance to blast the target with Fire magic, making this weapon deceptively powerful.

Written by Ur of Dalaran, this book contains a detailed account on the origins of the Worgen. "It is my hope that no Dalaran wizard seeks out the Worgen, even if done in light conscience. For no pact may be struck, no secrets may be learned, no good can come from these beasts. They are best left to their world. For if found in ours and not destroyed, our peril will be dire..."
The family seal of Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
The scepter of Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
The plate greaves of Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
The boots of Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
Fine leather gloves worn by Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
Locket formerly worn by Baroness Silverlaine of Shadowfang Keep.
Pendant worn by Baron Silverlaine, master of Shadowfang Keep.
The greatstaff wielded by Antonidas, leader of the Kirin Tor.

When the fighting was done, Dath'Remar stood painted in demon blood. As night fell, we knew that more battles remained, and yet, with this elf and this blade among us, we held out hope that victory did not lie beyond our grasp.
...not elven weapons. Not when they are reforged with magic, and hatred, and a burning need for revenge. No, Arthas. Felo'melorn is stronger than ever. As am I. - Kael'thas Sunstrider
A wand owned by Jaina Proudmore.
The locket opens to reveal an engraved image of Jaina Proudmoore.
A blue cloak worn by Jaina Proudmore. Adorned with a golden anchor, the emblem of her native homeland Kul'Tiras.
A ring worn by Jaina Proudmore. Bears an Alliance seal.
Sound the Mrglgrlhjorn, causing a stampede of murloc tadpoles. Not a very effective tactic, even by murloc standards.
Trident wielded by Brack, a murloc that patrolled the coastline of Longshore, Westfall.

The remains of the gargantuan red dragon were found in the Wetlands shortly after the Battle of Grim Batol. Tyrannistrasz was rumored to have been the elder consort of the Dragonqueen, Alexstrasza. Tyranastrasz died during the Second War, having been killed by Deathwing following a period of captivity with the Dragonmaw clan of Orcs. His skull was recovered by the Explorers' League and placed on display in Ironforge. A prestigious find, although the dragonflight are unlikely to approve of such a trophy.
The pet of Arugal, Archmage of Shadowfang Keep. Will fiercely defend his master from any intruders, and intimidate enemies with a thundering roar.

Glibb looks at you curiously. Brann doesn't have the heart to tell him he's not a monkey. The pet gorilla of Brann Bronzebeard, founder of the Explorers' League. A native of Stranglethorn, he has accompanied his master on numerous expeditions, namely the ill-fated trip to Silithus.
A black dragon welp. Likely a reward from Nefarius of the black dragonflight to the Blackrock clan of Orcs, in recognition of their successful capture of Stonewatch Keep in the Redridge Mountains.
A charger with blue livery and gold-plated armor. It exudes a golden aura.
This warhorse is white and has a blue and silver livery.
